unit_learning_outcomes.description: Apply the various statistical techniques and quantitative methods in solving practical insurance problems.
Construct risk models with frequency and severity distributions.
Use premium principles to price insurance products.
Apply time series models to financial and economic variables.
Model dependence and extreme events by copulas and extreme value theory.
Model insurance claims using loss distributions.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Preparation for lectures and various assessment items.

assessments.description: There are two individual written assignments on problem solving using R.
The final examination will be closed book, a three-hour written paper with ten minutes reading time, to be held during the University Examination period.
The test will be approximately 90 minutes, to be held during class time.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances
data.subject_search_title: ACST8085 - Quantitative Methods for Risk Analysis

academic_org.value: Department of Actuarial Studies and Business Analytics

data.description: This unit explores the use of statistical models in insurance: loss distributions with and without risk sharing, compound distributions and their applications in risk modelling, introduction to copulas, extreme value theory. The concepts underlying time series models and actuarial applications of time series models are also studied. Students gaining a weighted average of credit across all of ACST8084, ACST8085 and the CS2-related components of the assessment in ACST8086 (minimum mark of 60% on all three components) will satisfy the requirements for exemption from the professional subject CS2 of the Actuaries Institute.
data.search_title: ACST8085 - Quantitative Methods for Risk Analysis
